thread.title: CHS Girls' Tennis: Pirates headed to State after two wins Tuesday and one Wednesday
thread.title_full: CHS Girls' Tennis: Pirates headed to State after two wins Tuesday and one Wednesday

title: CHS Girls' Tennis: Pirates headed to State after two wins Tuesday and one Wednesday
text: Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 11:57 AM Updated at 2:27 PM Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 11:57 AM Updated at 2:27 PM • Pirate girls' tennis Update, after Pirate win Wednesday morning: The Pirate girls' tennis team defeated Staples-Motley 5-2, clinching them the Section title, and a spot in the State Original recap of Tuesday's action: The Pirate girls’ tennis team won a pair of Section tournament matches Tuesday, one in the morning and one in the afternoon to punch their ticket to the Section final on Wednesday morning. The Pirates faced off with Wadena-Deer Creek first, and were dominant, winning 7-0, and only dropping one set along the way. For the complete results, go online to crookstontimes.com . In the afternoon, the Pirates faced Roseau, the lone Section opponent to defeat the Pirates this season, and when the lineups were released the Pirates were quite surprised. The Rams rearranged their lineup quite a bit from their first match, in order to try to take a few spots, and make the Pirates work for their win. “I just told the girls that if they play well they’re going to win,” head coach Mike Geffre said. “It doesn’t matter what Roseau does, we just have to worry about ourselves.” At first, however, it looked like the Ram strategy might work, as at one point, five matches were going on, and the Pirates were losing in four. “A little bit,” Geffre admitted when asked if he was a bit nervous after the fast start from Roseau. “But I know my kids were going to fight. They have enough confidence in their ability that they’re not going to quit; they’re going to keep coming at you.” And that’s just what the Pirates did, as three of the four matches in which the Pirates dropped the first set not only saw the Pirates win the second, but also the third, as the Pirates sported three very important come-from-behind wins. Those wins came from the number three doubles duo of Alyssa Schultz and Elise Tangquist (who have lost just once when playing together all season), Jaeden Lizakowski at the number four singles spot, and Alyssa Fee at the number two singles spot. Fee’s match, in particular, stood out to her coach. “She lost the first set; was down in the second set; won the set in a tiebreaker; and then won the third,” Geffred noted. “She could have been done several times, but she kept coming back. That was great to see.” In regards to the third doubles duo of Schultz and Tangquist, Geffre said, “They just get getting better and better as the match went on,” and that could really have been said about all the Pirate players. For a team that looked to be on the ropes early in the match, the Pirates ended up topping Roseau 6-1, in an impressive turn around. Page 2 of 2 - Pirate box scores for Tuesday Crookston 7 Wadena-Deer Creek 0 Score #1 S Ally Tiedemann Whitney Eickhoff 6-1, 6-1 #2 S Alyssa Fee Abby Westrum 6-2, 2-6 10-6 #3 S Kendall Wahouske McKayla Woods 6-1, 7-6 (7-2) #4 S Jaeden Lizakowski Grace Hinojos 6-0, 6-0 #1 D Amy Follette Becky Wilke 6-0, 6-2 Leah Trostad Haley Ostgaard #2 D Tori Demarais Claire Rix 6-3, 6-1 Elisa Samuelson Melissa Glatt #3 D Alysa Schultz Lauren Jenni 6-0, 6-1 Elise Tangquist Brenna Mjones Crookston 6 Roseau 1 Score #1 S Ally Tiedemann Jodi Ostroski 6-3, 6-1 #2 S Alyssa Fee Lauren Johnson 4-6, 7-6 (7-3), 6-1 #3 S Kendall Wahouske Kate Wensloff 7-6 (7-2), 6-4 #4 S Jaeden Lizakowski Josee Lundgren 4-6, 6-2, 6-1 #1 D LeahTrostad Madie Lee 6-1, 6-4 Amy Follette Kora Torkelson #2 D Tori Demarais Sable Knochenmus 6-2, 6-2 Elisa Samuelson Kacie Bjerk #3 D Alysa Schultz Ellcie Murphy 5-7, 6-3, 6-1 Elise Tangquist Mackenzie Bergstrom
